page.title: 11Bayford Footpath Walk 1.
page.content: This footpath was walked in mid June and is 2.5 km long. It starts at the{Bakers Arms,}you cross to a well surfaced track by a farm, and then cross a stile on your right.The path goes for about 100m on good firm ground to next stile.You continue by a fence to a copse,and third stile. After another 400m, the path gets slippery,{boots are advised}in bad weather.100m on the path is overgrown and poorly marked.You cross a wooden bridge on your right , and it is again very overgrown .Then you head uphill into a muddy wood, after about 100m you walk downhill to a second bridge. The path continues by the{railway {line}for about 300m to another bridge. Across it you turn left and continue along a track for 700m until you get to B'don Lane and then into Hertford.
